title.narrative: Encouraging Women to Join Non-Traditional Industries

description.narrative:
Through Sharek's existing partnerships with VTCs under the umbrella of the Ministry of Labour (MoL) across the West Bank, this project will empower young women within these centers to pursue non-traditional sectors and industries. The project will provide young women with innovative trainings in order to equip them with the skills to do so; these will include life skills (including self-confidence, presentation, public speaking, self-advocating etc) and technical skills. The technical skills unit will be focused on new and innovative sectoral areas that will provide young women with an edge in the labour market, including: entrepreneurship and innovation, IT, new media, and digital tools.
Centre for Youth Economic Empowerment (CYEE) at Sharek Youth Forum: Mission: CYEE is investing in youth development through a cooperative effort with Palestinian businesses, educational institutions, government and society. CYEE works to develop youth capacity through work-skills training and entrepreneurship support; to broaden and enhance youths' outlook through career guidance and practical work experience; and to improve education and opportunities for young job seekers and entrepreneurs through research and advocacy.
Vision: The Centre for Youth Economic Empowerment recognizes that social, political and economic empowerment are integrated requirements for the pursuit of youth growth towards independence. CYEE envisages a free Palestine where young people have equal access to all opportunities, an understanding of their stake in society, and can take responsibility for their own lives and wellbeing. CYEE seeks an enabling environment for work, education and business where Palestinian youth can look to the future with optimism.
